Package main

Class Map

java.lang.Object
main.Map
public class Map
extends java.lang.Object
The Map class is used to contain all relevant information about a particular level; All levels are loaded at start-up, and their map file is parsed, checked and stored to be used by the game when spawning Pacman, ghosts, walls, and point pickups. The constructor for the Map class is private; this means you cannot use the new keyword to create an instance. Instead, the static loadFromFile must be used. Once start-up is complete, maps should be accessed via the MapController.
Author:
Harry Felton
See Also:
loadFromFile(String), MapController

  • Field Details

    • points

      protected final int[] points
      A 1D array of the map. The map is split in to a grid, where each integer in here presents one grid square. A 1 indicates that this the grid is traversable (path); 0 means it is not (wall). Additionally, 2 indicates a spawn point for Pacman, 3 indicates a large point spawn and 4,5,6 indicate spawn points for the ghosts

    • pacmanSpawnPoint

      protected java.awt.Point pacmanSpawnPoint
      The spawn point of the Pacman in this map; grid-based. Must be converted to pixel based co-ordinates before this can be used for drawing/spawning.

    • ghostSpawnPoints

      protected java.util.LinkedList<java.awt.Point> ghostSpawnPoints
      The spawn points of the various ghosts in this map; grid-based. Must be converted to pixel based co-ordinates before this can be used for drawing/spawning.

    • id

      protected final int id
      The ID of the level as loaded from the map file

    • name

      protected final java.lang.String name
      The name of the level as loaded from the map file

    • levelHeaderPattern

      protected static final java.util.regex.Pattern levelHeaderPattern
      A regular expression used to parse out the level information (ID and name)

    • pathColour

      protected final java.awt.Color pathColour
      The color to be used when drawing part of the game grid that is marked as a path/spawn point/etc

    • wallColour

      protected final java.awt.Color wallColour
      The color to be used when drawing part of the game grid that is marked as a wall

  • Constructor Details

    • Map

      private Map​(int[] points, int id, java.lang.String name)
      Private constructor for the Map. Private as the only way this class should be instantiated is via the static loadFromFile method.
      Parameters:
      points - The array of points used to make up the map
      id - The identifier of the map
      name - The label of the map

  • Method Details

    • isValidLocation

      protected boolean isValidLocation​(int x, int y)
      Tests if the position provided is a valid grid-based position.
      Parameters:
      x - The grid-based X position to test
      y - The grid-based Y position to test
      Returns:
      True if the X/Y position is inside the bounds of the map

    • isPath

      public boolean isPath​(int x, int y)
      Tests if the position provided is a valid path position for the path finding
      Parameters:
      x - The grid-based X position to test
      y - The grid-based Y position to test
      Returns:
      True if the position provided is a path, false if it's blocked

    • prepareMap

      public java.util.ArrayList<Pickup> prepareMap​(PacmanGame game)
      Prepares the map for game play by scanning over the map and creating pickups based on the map specified.
      Parameters:
      game - The game instance the map belongs to
      Returns:
      An array of Pickups to be spawned before the map is played

    • scanMap

      protected void scanMap() throws InvalidMapException
      Scans the map for spawn points, storing them for later; this allows us to selectively spawn certain ghosts and pickups on the map.
      Throws:
      InvalidMapException - Thrown if the map is invalid (missing points, multiple pacman spawn points, etc)

    • draw

      public void draw​(PacmanGame game)
      Draw the map by iterating through the points stored in the map data, and drawing the game grid.
      Parameters:
      game - The PacmanGame instance the map is to be drawn to

    • loadFromFile

      public static Map loadFromFile​(java.lang.String path) throws InvalidMapException
      Loads a map from a file. This file must be of the correct format: - Line 1 must contain the level number and name (ID - NAME) - All subsequent lines must of the same width - The amount of lines will be checked against the size of the game window
      Parameters:
      path - The string pointing to the file used for loading
      Returns:
      The map created from this file
      Throws:
      InvalidMapException - Thrown if the map is invalid (missing points, multiple pacman spawn points, etc)

    • getId

      public int getId()
      Fetches the ID of the map
      Returns:
      The ID

    • getName

      public java.lang.String getName()
      Fetches the name of the map
      Returns:
      The name

    • getPoints

      public int[] getPoints()
      Fetches the array of points that make up this map
      Returns:
      The points

    • calculateFlankRoute

      public java.awt.Point calculateFlankRoute​(java.awt.Point baseLocation, int distance, Entity.DIRECTION flankDirection)
      This method will calculate a location that is a certain distance INFRONT of a moving entity, including taking corners in the map in the event that a wall is reached.
      Parameters:
      baseLocation - The location to start the calculation from.
      distance - The amount of tiles to traverse.
      flankDirection - The initial starting direction, usually of the entity located at the baseLocation.
      Returns:
      The point with which to navigate to in order to flank the moving entity.

    • getPacmanSpawnPoint

      public java.awt.Point getPacmanSpawnPoint()
      Provides the point that specifies the position that Pacman should be spawned at, pixel-based
      Returns:
      The point, in pixel based format.

    • getGhostSpawnPoints

      public java.util.LinkedList<java.awt.Point> getGhostSpawnPoints()
      Fetches the list of ghost spawn points to use
      Returns:
      The points to spawn the ghosts at

    • getGridBasedPoint

      public static java.awt.Point getGridBasedPoint​(java.awt.Point p)
      Given a point, makes it grid based and returns it
      Parameters:
      p - The point to be made grid based
      Returns:
      Grid based version of this point

    • getGridBasedPoint

      public static java.awt.Point getGridBasedPoint​(int x, int y)
      Given an X and Y position, returns a point that is made grid relative
      Parameters:
      x - The pixel-based X position
      y - The pixel-based Y position
      Returns:
      The grid based Point
